Kerap Memicu Banjir, Sampah Jadi Objek Simulasi Sekolah Sungai Cimahi
02 Nov 2019, 01:17 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR).- Problematika sampah menjadi objek pembahasan dalam Simulasi Sekolah Sungai Cimahi (SSC) di kampus Universitas Jenderal Achmad Yani (Unjani) Jalan Terusan Sudirman Kota Cimahi, Jumat 1 November 2019. Akibat sampah yang menyumbat saluran air berpotensi memicu banjir hingga menggenangi permukiman maupun badan jalan di Kota Cimahi.
Simulasi SSC digelar di gedung Jurusan Teknik Sipil Fakultas Teknik Unjani. Peserta sekolah terdiri dari masyarakat perwakilan Kel. Cigugur Tengah dan Kel. Melong, jajaran staf Kelurahan, dinas terkait Pemkot Cimahi, serta akademisi dari Unjani dan Politeknik Negeri Bandung.
Ariani Budi Safarina selaku penggagas kegiatan tersebut mengatakan, simulasi SSC merupakan uji coba dari kurikulum pembelajaran sungai di Kota Cimahi yang sudah disusun. "Kondisi sungai di Kota Cimahi menyimpan potensi bencana alam banjir. Banyak penyebab atau pemicu banjir, tapi yang paling kasat mata yaitu keberadaan sampah di badan sungai sehingga hal itu coba kita sampaikan ke masyarakat," ujarnya.
Pemilihan wilayah Kel. Cigugur Tengah dan Kel. Melong terutama sebagai daerah langganan banjir. "Banyak penyebab banjir di Melong dengan aliran Sungai Cibeureum dan Cigugur Tengah dengan aliran Sungai Cilember.
"Hasil kajian, tingkat kerusakan banjir Sungai Cilember bisa lebih besar dibanding banjir di Rancaekek. Yang mudah kelihatan, ya setelah banjir berlalu sampah berserakan," ujarnya.
Di sisi lain, narasumber dari Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Kota Bandung mengklaim pengelolaan sampah mencapai 95% berdasarkan kajian konsultan. "Peserta perwakilan masyarakat membantah, karena pengakuan mereka keberadaan TPS cukup terbatas jadinya banyak warga bingung kemana menyalurkan sampah. Sehingga, yang terlihat ya sampah berakhir di saluran air baik drainase perkotaan maupun badan sungai," katanya.
Karena itu, para pengambil kebijakan perlu berkumpul bersama masyarakat dengan mediasi dari perguruan tinggi. Apalagi, pemerintah sebaiknya menggunakan riset perguruan tinggi karena menggunakan metodologi penelitian, review, serta kontrol ulang.
Terdapat beberapa poin yang disusun dalam kertas kerja bersama. "Banyak hal tidak tersambung antara program pemerintah dan layanan yang diterima masyarakat, istilah Pak Presiden RI Jokowi, hanya sebatas 'sent' tapi tidak 'delivered'. Kita menggali hal seperti itu, ke depan bisa diskusi bersama untuk mencari solusi," tuturnya.
Pihaknya berencana mengajukan SSC ke Kementrian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan. Penyelenggaraan SSC akan berlangsung di 3 tahun ke depan.
"Kalau bisa diselenggarakan, saya ingin sampai masuk ke pengusulan APBD karena Pemkot Cimahi bakal menjadi mitra kerja," ungkapnya.
Malah, Pemkot Cimahi pernah menggelar pelatihan pemeliharaan sungai dan pengolahan sampah di RW 03 Kel. Melong. "Materi dasar ternyata sudah dikuasai warga, dan itu hal yang bagus. Sayangnya, kegiatan tidak berlanjut. Karena itu, salah satu usulan bagaimana ada kesinambungan program dan kegiatan yang efektif sehingga pemahaman masyarakat meningkat dan muncul kepedulian terhadap sungai di Kota Cimahi. Kita mengajak semua pihak tak terkecuali untuk mengenal sungai, bukan hanya apa itu sungai tapi bagaimana menyelesaikan masalah di sungai tak terkecuali bencana," ujarnya.***

Often Triggering Floods, Waste Becomes the Object of Cimahi River School Simulation
02 Nov 2019, 01:17 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR) .- Waste problem becomes the object of discussion in the Cimahi River School Simulation (SSC) on the campus of Jenderal Achmad Yani University (Unjani) Jalan Terusan Sudirman, Cimahi City, Friday, November 1, 2019. As a result of rubbish that clogs waterways has the potential to trigger flooding until inundate settlements and roadways in Cimahi City.
The SSC simulation was held in the Civil Engineering Department building, Faculty of Engineering Unjani. School participants consisted of community representatives. Cigugur Tengah and Kel. Melong, Kelurahan staff, related offices of the Cimahi City Government, and academics from Unjani and Bandung State Polytechnic.
Ariani Budi Safarina as the initiator of the activity said, the SSC simulation was a trial of the river learning curriculum in Cimahi City that had been prepared. "The condition of the river in Cimahi City holds the potential for natural disasters. There are many causes or triggers for flooding, but the most visible is the presence of garbage in the river body so that we try to convey it to the community," he said.
Election area of Ex. Cigugur Tengah and Kel. Melong mainly as a flooded area. "Many causes of flooding in Melong with the Cibeureum River flow and Central Cigugur with the Cilember River flow.
"The results of the study, the level of flood damage in the Cilember River could be greater than the flood in Rancaekek. What is easily seen, yes, after the floods, garbage is scattered," he said.
On the other hand, a guest speaker from the Bandung City Environment Agency claimed that waste management reached 95% based on a consultant's study. "Participants from the community representatives denied that, because of their confession, the existence of the TPS was quite limited, so many residents were confused about where to dispose of garbage. So, what was seen was that garbage ended up in waterways, both urban drainage and river bodies," he said.
Therefore, policy makers need to gather together with the community with mediation from universities. Moreover, the government should use tertiary research because it uses research methodology, reviews, and re-controls.
There are several points arranged in a joint work paper. "Many things are not connected between government programs and services received by the public, according to President Jokowi's term, only limited to 'sent' but not 'delivered'. We explore things like that, in the future we can discuss together to find solutions," he said.
It plans to submit SSC to the Ministry of Education and Culture. The SSC will be held in the next 3 years.
"If it can be held, I want to get into the proposed APBD because Cimahi City Government will be a working partner," he said.
In fact, the Cimahi City Government once held a river maintenance and waste management training in RW 03 Kel. Melong. "The basic material turned out to have been mastered by the residents, and that is a good thing. Unfortunately, the activity did not continue. Therefore, one of the proposals is how there is continuity of effective programs and activities so that community understanding increases and concern for rivers in the City of Cimahi arises. We invite all "The party is no exception to know the river, not only what is a river, but how to solve problems in a river, including disasters," he said. ***
